skill.name: e2e-testing-patterns
skill.description: Master end-to-end testing with Playwright and Cypress to build reliable test suites that catch bugs, improve confidence, and enable fast deployment. Use when implementing E2E tests, debugging flaky tests, or establishing testing standards.
skill.summary: Master end-to-end testing with Playwright and Cypress to build reliable test suites that catch bugs,...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains instructional content and code examples for E2E testing patterns. No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: E2E tests often become flaky and slow. This skill provides Playwright and Cypress patterns to create stable, fast test suites. Get guidance on page objects, waiting strategies, and test organization.
actual_capabilities: Explains Playwright configuration patterns for retries, reporters, and projects
Shows Page Object Model structure with TypeScript examples
Provides waiting strategies and network interception patterns
Covers Cypress custom commands and intercept usage
Includes visual regression, sharding, and accessibility testing
Guides on debugging failing tests with trace viewers
limitations: Does not run tests or verify results in your environment
Does not generate selectors or test data for your application
Does not install dependencies or set up CI pipelines
Does not replace unit or integration testing guidance

use_cases.title: Stabilize flaky tests
use_cases.description: Apply waiting strategies and network mocks to reduce flakiness in critical flows.

use_cases.title: Create Playwright suites
use_cases.description: Build page objects and reusable fixtures for reliable user journey tests.

use_cases.title: Set testing standards
use_cases.description: Define E2E scope, selectors, and best practices for a team-wide approach.

prompt_templates.title: Start E2E basics
prompt_templates.scenario: New project with no E2E tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a minimal E2E test strategy and first two Playwright tests for login and checkout.

prompt_templates.title: Fix flaky waits
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my E2E wait patterns and suggest stable alternatives to fixed timeouts.

prompt_templates.title: Design page objects
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a Page Object Model layout for login, dashboard, and settings flows.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced testing plan
prompt_templates.scenario: Need cross browser and accessibility coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan using sharding, visual regression, and axe accessibility checks.

output_examples.input: Give me a stable Playwright login test pattern
output: Use role and label selectors for resilience against DOM changes
Wrap login steps in a reusable page object class
Assert URL change and dashboard heading visibility after login
Use auto-waiting assertions instead of manual waitForTimeout

best_practices: Use data attributes or accessible selectors for test stability
Keep tests independent with clean setup and teardown per test
Prefer auto-waiting assertions over fixed delays and timeouts
anti_patterns: Relying on nth-child or deeply nested CSS selectors
Using fixed timeouts to handle async UI operations
Coupling tests by sharing state or fixtures across test cases

faq.question: Is this compatible with Playwright and Cypress?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes patterns and examples for both testing frameworks.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and patterns but does not run or validate tests.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: It outlines CI-friendly patterns like sharding but does not configure your CI.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides instructional content and code examples.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot flaky tests?
faq.answer: Use targeted waits, network mocks, and isolate data setup per test run.

faq.question: How does it compare to unit testing guidance?
faq.answer: It focuses on user journeys and E2E scope, not unit-level logic testing.
